title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
–Senior Software Engineer

We are looking for a Senior S oftware E ngineer to work on a new project that merges recruitment with advertising technology . Working with product management, collaborating with world - wide development squads in an agile environment, you will work on features that have an impact on job seekers, recruiters, and employers to match the right candidate to the right job.

Monster is transforming. We are modernising our platform and services to simplify the process of finding the right candidate for the right job. We want it to be a rewarding experience for all involved.

At Monster, you will be part of an agile team that value innovative thinking, collaboration, and knowledge sharing. These are exciting times! Join us on the journey as we transform the future of connecting people and jobs.

Main responsibilities:
Participate in application development and prototyping using multiple technologies
Develop solutions in agile environment for all tiers of the applications Investigate and analyse reported defects and recommend solutions to these problems including code changes, data updates, or configuration modifications Work in a co-located scrum team Work with Amazon AWS services, and GCP
Conduct and assist in integration testing Actively participate and initiate continuous improvement of the Monster platform

Key technica l skills :
4+ years in Object Oriented or Functional Programming experience
Experience in Microservice s architecture Cloud experience such as Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform

Other relevant skills:
Self-motivated with time management skills to work in 2 week sprints
A bility to work both autonomously and within a team Experience in advertising technology

Skills

Scala, Kotlin , Microservices, AWS, GCP , Agile , SEO , Elasticsearch, DynamoDb , Reactive programming

Qualification
Relevant tertiary qualifications

Educational Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computing science or related technical field

title: Consultant
description:
IRI is powered by people
We're a fast paced, tech driven and people focused business. Innovation and entrepreneurism are part of our core DNA. We like to create, and we like to make things happen. Our team is diverse and is made up of Insight and Industry Consulting Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, Solution Architects, Software Engineers and Change Specialists.
As an organisation we're leading the charge as the specialist provider of data-driven, insight and consulting solutions for FMCG retailers and manufacturing sector.
We power over 500+ leading Australian businesses with a number of services and solutions including;
Client consulting services for the retail, grocery, liquor, tobacco and pharmaceutical sectors
Performance data processing and solutions for the FMCG sector
Consumer shopper, loyalty and analytics programs
Software development and cloud-based reporting platforms
So why IRI?
We're progressive, inclusive and people focused. We seek to create a down to earth culture which balances work and home life and enables our team to be the best that it can be. Our people are important to us and we offer a number of fantastic benefits including;
Flexible working both on and off-site
Employee training and continuous development programs
Women in leadership accelerated development opportunities
5 weeks annual leave and holiday buy back scheme
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Birthday leave
Summer half day Fridays
What are your key responsibilities as an Insights Consultant?
Define business problems through consultations with clients and provide solutions to their business needs
Solve briefs with actionable recommendations through incorporating analyses from different data sources
Provide and present insights through storytelling
Lead client relationships and proactively develop these relationships to deliver against account plan objectives
Take a lead role in business development activities
What are we looking for?
At least 3 years FMCG experience in data and insights, particularly using scan, continuous shopper panel or loyalty data
Ability to communicate and influence senior stakeholders
A confident and assertive nature
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to identify business development opportunities
Effective communication and presentation skills
Ability to build and maintain successful client relationships

title: Software Engineer
description:
Assignar
Infrastructure and construction sectors are booming and we are growing rapidly with it. At Assignar we are at the forefront of digitisation within the construction industry providing a SaaS platform for the planning and optimisation of construction operations. Assignar's data-driven technology makes our customers' construction work more efficient and more profitable. If you share our passion for building things and explaining how stuff works, you should definitely consider joining our fully remote team!
Software Engineer
We are expanding our engineering team and are looking for Software Engineers to join us and have a high impact. We are a group of technically skilled humans that have a strong bias for action, an emphasis on product, customer experience and love pushing the boundaries using technical innovations.
You will play a big role in solving problems that our customers are facing, architecting and implementing solutions that will catapult Assignar to the industry standard both in ConstructionTech and Software Development.
Skills we are looking for:
Experience building complex SaaS applications
Minimum 2 years of Software Development experience in web or mobile application development
Experience of JavaScript, using a modern front-end framework and/or a mainstream backend language/framework too
Strong understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases
Practical programming skills allowing you to debug complex problems
Appreciates and is committed to maintaining a cohesive and collaborative team culture through positive reinforcement and supportive feedback
A continuous learner who loves to work with cutting edge technologies, welcoming change and enjoys working in a dynamic environment
Motivated to share knowledge and best-practices to improve others' abilities around them
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
These skills would be a huge bonus:
GraphQL & Django
ReactJS, Typescript, Apollo
AWS services & Github Actions
Domain Driven Design
Experience developing mobile applications
Software Engineering, Computer Science or a similar university degree
We enable cross-functional development and empower teams to solve any problems that arise. Therefore, we are searching for someone who is willing to learn, advance all areas of their skillset and grow in other areas of the product.
At Assignar we aim to hire passionate, smart and inspiring individuals who want to be a part of building not only a great product but are keen to nurture and add to our incredible culture. High value is placed upon cultivating a friendly, collaborative and inclusive work environment where employees bring out the best in each other.

title: Silicon Engineer - 97221
description:
What you do at AMD changes everything

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.


SILICON ENGINEER
(Architecture / Micro-architecture and Modeling, Design, Design Verification

THE ROLE:
You will be part of a fast-paced team working on next generation GPU products. A team of varied disciplines who is responsible for architecture/micro-architecture of key graphics and compute features, architecture modeling, design and validation to deliver best in class graphics and compute products.

In an architecture/modeling role, you will be working very closely with the system architects (hardware and software) on defining and implementing key features in an architecture model to ensure performance goals are met.

In a design role, you will be working on defining/specifying the micro-architecture of next generation graphics features, RTL design capture, timing and power convergence. You will work closely with architects, power and physical design team to achieve PPA (power, performance, and area) goals.

In a DV role, you will be developing validation collaterals including testbenches (UVM and system verilog) and reference C-model. You will work with architecture, design and full chip validation/emulation teams to define, develop and execute test plans. You will be responsible for ensuring block is signed off meeting all quality metrics (function and code coverage, regression pass rate, test development) in addition to formal verification of key parts of the design (data path, clock gating and formal property FPV).

No idea is too small; we welcome every initiative that makes our product better. We challenge ourselves to improve current processes and methodologies and eager to adopt new ideas that would help improve IP quality and efficiency.
THE PERSON:
In order to be successful in this role, you will possess experience in the desired disciplines.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Key responsibilities for the various disciplines are highlighted above.

 PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
We are seeking professionals with various levels of experience.
ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Undergraduate degree in related discipline.

LOCATION:
Sydney, Australia

Requisition Number: 97221
Country/Region/Location: Australia State/Province: New South Wales City: Sydney
Job Function: Design
Hiring Manager: Naser Marmash

title: Customer Support Engineer, APAC
description:
SYDNEY: Blue Prism® is seeking an enthusiastic, motivated individual with excellent oral and written communication skills to join our team of highly skilled support staff. Primarily responsible for providing world class technical support to Blue Prism customers and partners. The role will be reporting to the Support Team Manager (Asia, Pacific and Japan). As our global customer base expands, the support analyst will also be required to work shift or on-call patterns to provide support for other time zones.

Requirements
Responsibilities would involve troubleshooting, analysing technical problems and working with customers and Blue Prism developers to resolve technical roadblocks. You will ensure all issues are resolved or escalated to the proper resources to resolve in a timely fashion. Additionally, you will manage communications with customers at all levels to maintain positive relationships.
Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
Manage customer support technical issues within our Support System on a daily basis, including verifying issues, isolating and diagnosing the problem, and resolving the issue where possible.
Provide technical support to customers, partners, sales engineers and post-sales consultants via telephone, email and the web.
Reproduce product behaviour to determine the problem root-cause and to find work-arounds and solutions.
Ability to ensure actions are followed-up in a timely manner and attention to detail.
Ability to deal with difficult customer situations.
Coordinate with other teams to provide assistance in identifying, reporting and resolving product defects.
Author, edit, publish and maintain an on-line knowledge base of known issues/solutions.
Technical Skills and Experience

Highly Desireable:
3+ years of experience in a software support or development role.
A high degree of analytical, trouble shooting and problem-solving abilities.
Knowledge and ability to troubleshoot current Windows operating systems (WinXP onwards)
Understanding of TCP/IP networks and security, LAN/WAN communication and configurations.
Exposure to basic programming skills with knowledge of VB /.NET/C# an advantage.
Thorough understanding of and ability to use Microsoft Office suite
Knowledge of virtualization technologies (eg Citrix, VMware)
Experience with one or more Blue Prism Technology Partner products, such as Appian, IBM Watson, ABBYY, Cyberark.

Desirable:
SQL programming skills and knowledge of SQL Server.
Web Development (eg. Java Script / HTML / HTML5 / PHP) skills
Data-interchange development (XML / Soap / JSON) skills
Good formal documentation skills

Person Specification
Initiative and ability to be productive without supervision
Experience in support of software products to include derivation of workarounds and fixes.
Excellent attention to detail with a passion for quality with strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to recognize problems, gather facts, analyse information with strong deductive reasoning skills
Ability to organize multiple work tasks and prioritize them to meet specific deadlines, work under own initiative and respond to peaks in demand
Ability to quickly grasp and understand new tasks and ideas and to work well as part of a team
Possess a strong desire for self-improvement and advancement with a strong and active interest in IT generally
Must be ambitious and prepared to commit to a rapidly growing company through a period of considerable expansion
Ability to work constructively together as a team, sharing ideas and resources.
Be passionate about delivering high quality service to customers and partners, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Benefits
Blue Prism Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.

title: Graduate Mechanical Engineer
description:
18579BR
Requisition Number:
18579BR
Description:
Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.
One difference between Stantec and our competitors is that we have an emphasis on professional and personal development and will take steps to help you achieve your career goals. We also have a culture of delivering as a team and our Brisbane office has a healthy and vibrant culture. At Stantec you will be backed by a Global company but delivering at a local level.
The role
Stantec is a global leader in the water infrastructure sector. We implement technically innovative water and wastewater solutions to manage and meet increasingly complex regulatory and quality standards while focusing on sustainable and cost-effective options. We provide a full suite of integrated water, wastewater, stormwater, solid waste and general civil, engineering and management advisory services to meet the needs of our clients using the latest innovative industry research and global experience.
Key accountabilities
\tCarry out site surveys, investigations and feasibility studies for proposed projects
\tAssist with collection and analysis of data and field samples as appropriate
\tProduce calculations, specifications and drawings to ensure that technical designs provide appropriate solution
\tSupport specific project including assisting with planning, co-ordination and report writing
\tAssist with communication and development ongoing contacts with clients as required
\tOrganise tender documents, assist in the evaluation of tenders and administration of contracts.
\tContribute to proposal and bid development to support business development activities, including preparing proposal material as required
\tComplete all work in line with Stantec Core Values and in accordance with the Stantec Quality, Safety & Environment Systems and Project Quality Procedures
\tMinimise and control risk by commitment to the Stantec Quality, Health & Safety programmes and ensuring proactive use of our project management systems
\tOther duties as reasonably required
The opportunity
We are looking for driven graduates to join our water engineering team based in our Brisbane office. You will join a team that works on water engineering projects, not only locally, but across Australia and the wider Asia Pacific region.
What we offer
Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.
\tFlexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts
\tLearning and Talent Development Programs including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
\tMentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor others
\tProfessional Memberships
\tIncome Continuance Insurance (ICI)
\tService Recognition Awards
\tEmployee Assistance Program
It couldn't be easier beginning your career in engineering with Stantec. As an Engineers Australia Partner, we'll pay your membership fees and assist you along the path to registration. You'll have the chance to work on leading-edge projects, fully supported by our comprehensive graduate development program.
To be eligible to apply you should have
\tTertiary qualification in respective degree in Mechanical Engineering by December 2020;
\tBe eligible to work in Australia;
\tHave a full clean current driving licence
In addition, our preferred candidate will also
\tHave either work experience, or an interest in developing, water engineering technical expertise related to water supply and sewer networks, water and wastewater treatment plants, and bulk water supply for regional and urban water authorities.
\tBe driven to develop experience in dealing with a range of clients and stakeholders including local authorities, government bodies and commercial companies.
\tStrong self-management skills as you will need to be able to prioritize workloads whilst maintaining strong and trusting working relationships with our Clients' and colleague's both locally and across the broader Stantec team.
\tFlexibility is required as you could be asked to work from other offices at times including client secondments.
\tWillingness to work towards chartership is required.
We would also like you to
\tSupply details of your education and experience to date, including an academic transcript;
\tInclude a cover letter outlining why you are applying and why we should short list you for interview.
Title:
Graduate Mechanical Engineer
Qualifications:
Tertiary qualification in Mechanical Engineering
Job Category:
Mechanical Engineering
About Stantec:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.
The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 350 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!
Location :
Australia-Queensland Brisbane, Australia-Queensland Gold Coast
Country:
Australia
State/Province:
Queensland
City:
Brisbane

title: Sales Engineer - APJ
description:
at EDB
Australia

The world loves Postgres. If you work with developers or data scientists or anyone wrangling data, you’ll probably see a sticker with the tusks and trunk of the Postgres elephant on the lid of a nearby laptop. EDB has a lot to do with that.

We’ve been major contributors to Postgres since the beginning, and we are proud to call thousands of boundary pushing customers our partners. Proud though we are, we are not resting on our laurels. There’s plenty of work to do. The good news is that everything we do will impact Postgres, which is to say that it will impact the world. No pressure.

Sales Engineer - APJ

Based in the Sydney, Australia.

Responsibilities:
This position will be responsible for driving growth and ongoing transformation of the APJ sales function to achieve critical business objectives. Interacting with customers/prospects/partners on a regular basis, hence it's not just a SE manager role.
Engage with existing ANZ customers and business partners, providing EDB technical expertise to help clients solve business problems and grow the subscription and services business.
Provide subject matter expertise to ensure that ANZ sales achieve their plan targets.
Work with EDB professional services to build statement of work required in the deployment of EDB solutions
Assist clients and partners to build training and enablement plans
Provide leadership to all EDB SE's in Asia Pacific & Japan, including enablement plans and project support
Provide single point of technical contact for IBM partner engagements in APJ, liaising with local EDB SE's to provide necessary tech support to IBM opportunities
Provide EDB product management & engineering guidance on EDB product usage and performance in APJ. Also provide product management competitive information

Requirements:
The SE should have customer-facing experience from previous roles with the ability to identify customer pain points just not in terms of database specific needs but the overall platform and data needs.

Ability to drive discussions and database related pain-points at CXO level and provide guidance in order to drive them for more adoption of EDB Postgres. It would include competing with native cloud databases or working with the cloud service providers etc.
Perform SE team management on a regular basis which includes team update calls, performance reviews, motivation and lead product orientation from the perspective of EDB selling motions specifically products, services and trainings.
Define the SE KPIs and guide, support individual SEs to achieve these KPIs.
Support key and strategic sales motions across APJ from a senior technical leadership perspective.

Minimum Criteria/Qualification: Below basically descriptions for an SE so can be chosen accordingly to compliment the SE leadership role.

At least 4 to 5 years of direct experience (in the past 8-10 years) in the following areas of sales motion:

Customer facing skills
Ability to deliver technical product presentations
Ability to demonstrate technical products and their feature sets
Ability to conduct product proof-of-concepts from initial requirements gathering to successfully achieving objectives and success criteria through clear planning and methodical execution

Database, Operating System Platform, and Software skills: At least 4 to 5 years of direct experience (in the past 8-10 years) in the following areas:

Hands-on experience in PostgreSQL or EDB Postgres databases or Oracle databases.
Relational database experience (PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server). Active use or, administration of such database(s);
Good understanding of NoSQL, unstructured data store concepts and familiarity with MongoDB, Hadoop, Cassandra etc.
Good knowledge of SQL, and SQL query tuning & debugging techniques
DB server tuning and debugging experience
Basic to intermediate Linux system administration experience
Software installation & software troubleshooting experience

Good understanding and hands-on experience of the following concepts in relation to PostgreSQL or EDB Postgres or Oracle:

High Availability
Upgrades/patching
Scalability
Performance
Security & related concepts

Personal attributes:
Motivated self-starter and self-learner
Team player with on-site partner/channels ecosystem, customers and remote EDB teams
Keen to travel and spend time in the field with customers, partners, System Integrators

Desirable Qualifications:
Foundational and/or experience in the following areas:
Cloud skills:
Private/Public/Hybrid Clouds - AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, VMWare Cloud, and OpenStack, Virtualization - in relation to the databases
Containers (Docker), Microservices, PaaS (Kubernetes, OpenShift) - In relation to Databases

Programming skills:
Understanding of (and able to write) SQL, PL/SQL or PL/pgSQL
Understanding of (and able to write) bash shell or Python scripts

Technical content development skills:
Ability to author solution collaterals and describe product features in response to the Request For Proposals.
Ability to coordinate Professional Services deliverables between Delivery and Solution Architect teams and customer teams.

We know it takes a unique mix of people and skills to help us in our mission to supercharge Postgres, and we understand that not everyone will check every box. We’d love to hear from you and we want you to apply!

EDB is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. EDB was built on a commitment to trust and respect each other and to embrace an array of people and ideas. These values remain at the center of our culture and are key to our company’s integrity.

title: Office Assistant - Bowral
description:
#20100514
20 May 2021

Office Assistant - Bowral
Northrop Consulting Engineers Pty Ltd
Bowral NSW 2576, Australia
Office Coordinator - Bowral
Office Coordination – Finance Administration - Reception
The Company
Northrop Consulting Engineers is an employee owned, multi-discipline consultancy that has been established for over 40 years. We have an open management structure that embodies a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce for all our employees.
We currently employ over 350 staff across eight offices in NSW, ACT, QLD, and VIC. We are essentially a people business that grows by creating opportunities for our people to help build the business and their career. When you join Northrop, you join a company that will support you to excel both professionally and personally.
The Role
Our Bowral office is in search of a tech savvy and motivated individual who is keen to learn, grow and make this role their own!
This is a varied position in our Bowral office with the successful candidate working across the office coordination, finance administration, data entry and general reception duties.
This position is a part-time position.
Based in our Bowral office, you will be joining a close knit team and will enjoy operating with an appropriate level of autonomy reporting to the Office Manager.
Day to day responsibilities include:
Finance Administration as required
Assisting with reception and other administrative duties.
Calling clients and maintaining correspondence and payments.
Project delivery/close out support
Onboarding and Offboarding of employees
Event coordination
Applying
Ready to take the next career step and develop to your full potential? Please click the ‘Apply’ button to complete your application. To learn more about this position please email careers@northrop.com.au
Northrop is an equal opportunity employer.
***No agencies please. Applications are sought from direct applicants only.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
Lead Data Engineer, Sydney, Viator


Who we are


At Tripadvisor, we believe there’s good out there. We understand that travel brings out the best in us, while lifting deserving businesses and strengthening the communities we meet along the way. We know that as the world’s largest travel site, we’re here to inspire and empower people to explore our world with confidence — and share their trip experiences with others. And every day, we see our ideas come to life in work that enables travellers to discover all the good the world has to offer. As part of the Tripadvisor team, you’ll have the opportunity to do the same.

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Viator engineering team in Sydney, Australia. Viator is a world leading marketplace for experiences and is part of TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site. The Viator team consists of world-class experts in SEO, usability, marketing, and of course, technology. Bring your skills and enthusiasm to this collaborative team.

The role will see you defining and implementing our data strategy within our marketplace platform that connects tour operators, travellers and third party distributors, including e-Commerce websites and multiple backend systems. You will work alongside our agile development teams using the latest technologies to deliver solutions in a fast paced and complex environment. If you are looking to be challenged technically and have fun, this is the place for you!

More about you


On your first day, we'd love for you to have:


Expertise and industry experience working with data warehouses, data lakes and reporting tools.
Experience building data pipelines and streaming / processing large amounts of data to / from cloud environments.
An understanding of CI/CD approach to platform builds.
A history of researching and trying out new technologies.
An understanding of software development fundamentals: testability, performance, simplicity - in essence, clean code.
A passion for working within a team (we prize our team culture) and the ability to work more autonomously from time to time.
The ability to lead both the business and delivery through strong engagement and influencing skills.
Eagerness to learn our business domain (without understanding our domain, we can’t get information from our data).


It would be nice if you have:


Experience with one or more prominent languages such as Java, Python, Bash, C#.
Industry experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform).
Experience leveraging machine learning to solve real problems.
An interest or involvement in open source software.
A degree in computer science or a related field (Science, Mathematics etc.).
A love of travel is not required, but hey - why not?

title: Quality Engineer - Manufacturing
description:
We are looking for a Quality Manufacturing Engineer to ensure the appropriate quality controls, improvements and production related quality systems are effectively implemented in our manufacturing facilities. In parallel, this person shall ensure the products are developed in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements, customer expectations and industry standards.


About you:
Ideally you have a mechanical and/or electrical engineering background. You are known for your strong problem-solving skills and for your attention to detail. You can be flexible, able to work in a matrix environment. You love to share your knowledge and mentor or support others when needed.
Above all, you enjoy the prospect of bringing your skills to a company that prides itself on making a difference to people’s lives.


About Saluda Medical:

We are a medical device company developing advanced neuromodulation systems for the next generation of implantable stimulation devices. We are a cutting edge, progressive Australian based company with offices and employees based in Europe and the USA. We are at the forefront of spinal cord stimulation technologies for the management of chronic pain.


Our team is made up of world-class engineers, clinicians and seasoned professionals with experience in bringing medical technologies to life.


About the role:

Project focus

The initial focus of this role will be to develop the in house testing capability with various industry standard machines, such as the Vision System and Force Gauge.
Programming of the Vision System (Micro-vu)


General

Develop test methods/procedures to support product acceptance activities.
Support DMR and DHF compliance assessments to ensure quality and regulatory requirements are successfully implemented and maintained
Continually assess the end to end process to ensure efficient, effective, predictable and timely quality control activities and provide metrics for Data Analysis and Management Review.
Ensure appropriate testing methodologies and processes are used and validated, develop novel methodologies when needed, this includes procuring equipment when necessary.
Ensure prompt investigation and action, and escalate quality issues based on appropriate analysis.
Initiate NCR and CAPA investigation and take actions as required including driving engineering change order to completion.
Assist development and maintenance of Manufacturing Quality Plans for quality control to ensure manufacturing process and product conformance.
Review and approve product design related protocols and reports on behalf of quality and regulatory to support regulatory submissions, as required.
Mentor QC inspectors & provide test method training
Participate in internal audits to ensure company's quality system is effective.


Essential Requirements:

A Bachelor's degree or higher in Electrical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
Experience with Micro-vu programming
Automated inspection instrument experience
Proven self-starter/able to take initiative
Critical thinker with High-level analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience mentoring others
Experience in Test Method development and Validations
Detailed oriented
Advanced written and verbal communication skills and ability to produce reports & presentations to a professional standard.
Good time-management skills
Great interpersonal skill
Ability to work in a team and with minimum supervision.
Knowledge of medical device regulatory requirements
Experience in medical device industry


Desirable Requirements:

Product lifecycle management system development
An understanding of the requirements of ISO 13485:2016 and/or 21CFR 820
